title: CSS
message:
- Stands for Cascading Style Sheets 
- Used to style html documents
- Using CSS you can control font, size, and color of text, add background images to your page, change the positioning and sizing of elements, and much more
- Place all CSS inside <style> tags away from the content page
- Most often inside of the head section of a page
- Listed inside of the curly braces 
- HTML attributes go inside the opening tag
- The CSS selector for class is .classname. The CSS selector for id #idName
